acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This original volume came to the Library of Virginia, under the accession number 36173, in a transfer of court records from Spotsylvania County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Spotsylvania County was formed from Essex, King William, and King and Queen Counties by a statute adopted in 1720 to take effect on 1 May 1721. The county was named for Alexander Spotswood, lieutenant governor of Virginia from 1710 to 1722.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Spotsylvania County (Va.) List of Jurors Summoned to Court, 1853-1887, is a comprehensive volume covering the names of individuals who attended and served on juries in both the county and circuit courts. During this time period, county residents served on grand juries, special grand juries, pettit juries, juries held for coroners' inquests, juries held for creating new roads (road petitions) and as part of a venire (jurors were chosen from a group of county residents selected for jury duty.) The volume covers the month and year summoned, the names of the individual jurors, the amount paid by the Commonwealth to attend and serve, the amount paid by the county to attend and serve and to whom the certificate was delivered. By 1881, specific court cases are listed (mainly commonwealth but other civil cases as well.) Jurors who attended and served at coroners' inquests (having to do with the death of an individual) are recorded by 1883. In 1886, mileage payments (based on number of days attending and number of miles traveled) were included in the amount given to individual jurors as payment for his service to the county. These payments would then be certified by the Auditor of Public Accounts.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by month and year.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Spotsylvania County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"

relatedmaterial.p: Spotsylvania County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities.
